abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Restructuring
            Program Project will support the Government of Mexico's
            Program, which is designed to: 1) restore the solvency and
            soundness of Mexico's banking system, restructure
            banks, and improve confidence in the financial system; 2)
            reform the accounting standards and prudential regulations
            for banks, and strengthen supervision to prevent future
            recurrence of systemic problems; 3) improve discipline in
            the provision of liquidity by the Central Bank; and 4)
            initiate reforms in development bank lending, accounting
            practices and regulation of financial groups, and the
            deposit protection system. The loan will support actions to:
            1) improve discipline and manage systemic risks in the
            provision of liquidity support by the Central Bank and
            resources from develoment finance entities; 2) determine the
            health of the banking system; 3) restructure troubled banks
            with the assistance of investment banking advisers; 4)
            reform accounting standards and prudential regulations for
            banks; 5) strengthen bank supervision; 6) improve the
            regulatory framework to facilitate corporate work-outs and
            debt restructuring; 7) remove obstacles to securitization
            and secured lending; and 8) formulate a revised set of
            prudential regulations for brokerage houses, and a revised
            scheme for deposit protection.
